Belated thanks to @OriolVinyalsML for mentioning the 1991 paper [1] on distilling the knowledge in a neural network (to do deep learning for long text before the LSTM). See [8] as well. I called it "collapsing," back then, not â€œdistilling." Also, I wasn't reviewer#2 of [2].
         
REFERENCES

[1] J. Schmidhuber (1991). Learning complex, extended sequences using the principle of history compression. Neural Computation, 4(2):234-242, 1992. Based on TR FKI-148-91, TUM, 1991. Sec. 3.2.2. and Sec. 4 are about "collapsing" [1] or "distilling" [2] the knowledge of a teacher net (the chunker) into a student net (the automatizer). Afterwards, the automatizer can do what the chunker could do. Such approaches are now widely used. See also [3][4][6][7][8].

[2] G. Hinton, O. Vinyals, J. Dean (2015). Distilling the Knowledge in a Neural Network. arXiv:1503.02531. See the 1991 paper [1] as well as Sec. H2 of [4]. See also [2a][2b].

[2a] Tweet by @OriolVinyalsML: Distillation has been on the news (!) due to @deepseek_ai. The paper https://t.co/Yd4fRhYGgC was actually rejected from NeurIPS 2014 due to lack of novelty (true-ish), and lack of impact. Thanks reviewer#2 (literally), and thanks for @arxiv! @geoffreyhinton @JeffDean https://t.co/1H44TLn0WG 

[2b] Reply tweet by @OriolVinyalsML: PS @SchmidhuberAI in 1991 published something related to compressing history length in RNNs, which may be very relevant for long context, an important topic of research today. https://t.co/mjSW94Oz8H 

[3] JS (AI Blog, 2021). 30-year anniversary: first very deep learning with unsupervised pre-training (1991) [1]. Unsupervised hierarchical predictive coding finds compact internal representations of sequential data to facilitate downstream learning. The hierarchy of networks can be distilled [1][4] into a single deep neural network. 1993: solving problems of depth >1000.

[4] J. Schmidhuber. How 3 Turing awardees republished key methods and ideas whose creators they failed to credit. Technical Report IDSIA-23-23, Swiss AI Lab IDSIA, 14 Dec 2023. See Sec. H2 on "collapsing" [1] or "distilling" [2] the knowledge in a neural network. Tweet: https://t.co/0fJVklY6DZ 

[5] J. Schmidhuber (JS, 2015). On Learning to Think: Algorithmic Information Theory for Novel Combinations of Reinforcement Learning Controllers and Recurrent Neural World Models. arXiv 1210.0118. Sec. 5.3 describes a reinforcement learning (RL) prompt engineer which learns to query its model for abstract reasoning and planning and decision making.

[6] JS (2018). One Big Net For Everything. arXiv 1802.08864. See also US patent US11853886B2. Collapsing the reinforcement learner and the world model of [5] (e.g., a foundation model) into a single network, using the neural network distillation procedure of 1991 [1]. Essentially what's now called an RL "Chain of Thought" system, where subsequent improvements are continually distilled into a single net. 

[7] #DeepSeekR1 (2025): Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via Reinforcement Learning. arXiv 2501.12948 

[8] 2025 tweet: #DeepSeek [1] uses elements of the 2015 reinforcement learning prompt engineer [5] and its 2018 refinement [6] which collapses the RL machine and world model of [5] into a single net. This uses the neural net distillation procedure of 1991 [1]: a distilled chain of thought system. https://t.co/HIVU8BX80q

Everyone knows Solana is a VC coin. Retail players canâ€™t really win against it. Donâ€™t you remember what happened with FTX? 

Solana tanked to almost zero and somehow got rescued back. Thatâ€™s not a free market, thatâ€™s an inside game. Some secret info before here ğŸ§µğŸ‘‡

Look, the real issue with Solana isnâ€™t just about reliability or speed. Yeah, sure, it suddenly went into â€œslo modeâ€ right when Trump coin started pumping and then collapsing, convenient timing, right? But thatâ€™s not the core problem.

The real issue is Firedancer. It was developed alongside Jump Crypto, a firm whose entire existence in traditional markets is about extracting money from retail players. And guess what? Theyâ€™re doing the same thing here. Solanaâ€™s gas fees and speed donâ€™t exist to help the average investor, they exist to give Jump Trading and other market makers an insane information advantage. Even if one individual trader doesnâ€™t feel it, the net effect on the masses is pure extraction.

They hold a ridiculous edge over retail. And honestly? Speed doesnâ€™t even matter for the average investor. Ethereum, on the other hand, is actually decentralized. The number of devs building on ETH completely outpaces Solana, and the competition in ETHâ€™s L2 ecosystem is thriving. Thatâ€™s healthy.

Solana, on the other hand? Itâ€™s been designed as a long-term extraction machine, just like how traditional financial markets work today. 62% of its tokens went straight into the hands of VCs and insiders. Itâ€™s just another version of Web2 big tech, where people are the product.

That said, for memecoins and AI agents, Solana does have the biggest market share. If youâ€™re a degen looking for quick plays, it makes sense to be there. Itâ€™s just really up to you, do you want your money in centralized hands, or would you rather put it in something more decentralized like Ethereum?

For the last two-three years we had to listen to Yellen and Powell insist that "the economy was great" and "banks were incredibly strong".

This was BS. Jobs numbers were being propped up by massive Government hires. Bank "health" was the result of "innovative" programs like the "BTFP", and "paying depositors 0.1% while earning 5%". 

Consumers managed to spend their way out of Covid by massively ramping up credit card debt. The average card balance is being financed at a mind boggling 29% APR. This can't continue.

The deficit has gotten completely out of control. Interest payments are 1 Trillion per year, exceeding defense.

We need to stop this insanity. Rates need to come down. Massive DEI Government Hiring sprees need to go in reverse. Banks need to stop being protected by the Fed and Elizabeth Warren.

We need to let AI and Crypto do their things. Let the machines take over. Let DeFi replace banks. Adopt Bitcoin as Hard Money store of Value.

I finally got around to reading â€œReWorkâ€ by @dhh and @jasonfried, a wonderful invitation to rethinking how we work, what purpose should work serve in our lives, and why lots of conventional wisdom is not helpful in either of those regards. The book was written a while back, and it has aged really well. In fact, Iâ€™d argue that with the monumental changes in the economy that are just ahead, itâ€™s probably more relevant than ever.

Five years ago this week, the US & most of the world was locked down by politicians over â€œCovid19â€.

By now it should be clear to all thinking people that this was both a scam of epic proportions and a gross violation of human rights.

Weâ€™ve never had a proper accounting of how and why this tyranny happened. 

Remember the videos of people dropping dead in the streets?  We now know they were fake. Remember the â€œventilator shortagesâ€?  Remember the hospital ships coming to relieve the â€œfullâ€ hospitals?  Remember the concerns of morgues overflowing?   All of it was a sham.   

The academics, the scientists, the NGOs, the politicians, the medical community - they were all wrong.  All wrong.  They censored and arrested those who stood against the tyranny as they violated human rights.   They were wrong both about the risk â€” Covid was not nearly as deadly as they claimed, and they were wrong about the measures to deal with it.  No matter how deadly, itâ€™s never legitimate for government to interfere with freedoms in this way. 

Now we should all look back and remember the tyranny and ask why this happened.  Most importantly we must make sure it never happens again.  No matter how deadly a virus the government does not have the right to override the risk preferences of an individual.   Theyâ€™ve tried to bring back the tyranny with â€œOmicronâ€ and other efforts and the next pandemic of tyranny may be driven by something else entirely.  But now is the time we can all decide that this will never happen again.  We will not comply.

It's time for Interplanetary Scaling Explorations

During all these years I've always considered myself an Ethereum maximalist and I must admit that I was very skeptical when @StarkWareLtd announced developments about settling @Starknet on Bitcoin alongside Ethereum.

However, after diving deeper in the hard work of the Gigabrains from @StarkWareLtd and the 
@StarknetFndn, I now believe that this bidirectional approach is the right path to follow.

One of the things that made me fall in love with @Starknet and with @StarkWareLtd approach to scalability since the StarkEx early days was their originality and their experimental attitude in solving complex problems. 
They have been pioneers in the Ethereum scaling scene and I also think they even had to pay a very high price for their originality as some Ethereum OGs have always had a discriminating negative bias towards Starknet for not being EVM compatible. I personally never understood such behaviours and I believe that trying new, original approaches to solve problems is one of the most important core values of Ethereum and the whole Starknet community fully embraced this principle during these years.

The Ethereum L2 War1 is over and we are now entering a new age

Scaling on the Ethereum planet will remain one of the most exciting landscapes in this industry but it's now time for Interplanetary Scaling Explorations as well.

@Starknet maintains its feet well grounded on @ethereum while starting a new adventure, settling on Bitcoin and enabling next-gen scaling in the first and most successful Blockchain so far. 

Pioneering is a lifestyle for our community.

Let's keep on writing the History of Scaling together, my dear @Starknet fam!

Something great is about to begin and I'm looking forward to creating a lot of content about this new exciting era âœ¨

Your Ultimate Yield Farming Guide on Sonic (Part 1)

1. Shadow DEX: Delta-Neutral S/stS Liquidity
2. Rings Protocol: Yield-Bearing Stablecoins
3. Vicuna Finance: Leveraged Concentrated Liquidity
4. Spectra Finance: Fixed-Rate Yield Vaults
5. Vertex Protocol: Perpetuals Yield Farming

ğŸ‘‡ğŸ‘‡

1. Shadow DEX: Delta-Neutral S/stS Liquidity

@ShadowOnSonic is a decentralized exchange providing liquidity pools with aggressive fee structures and high APR through concentrated liquidity.

Strategy: Provide liquidity to the S/stS pool (S is Sonicâ€™s native token, stS is its staked version) in an aggressive price range, hedge spot S exposure with a short position on Hyperliquid, and stack Sonic Activity Points.

Estimated APR: ~116% (from liquidity provision) + Sonic points (16x multiplier for activity).

Steps:
â€¢ Acquire $S and convert some into staked S $stS via Beethoven X.
â€¢ Provide liquidity to the S/stS pool on Shadow DEX within a tight price range (Â±5% around market price).
â€¢ Hedge price exposure by opening a 1x short position on S via Hyperliquid, neutralizing volatility.
â€¢ Accumulate Sonic Activity Points (16x multiplier due to asset deployment).

Risks: Impermanent loss mitigated by hedging, smart contract vulnerabilities, hedging slippage.

2. Rings Protocol: Yield-Bearing Stablecoins

@Rings_Protocol issues scUSD, a yield-bearing stablecoin backed by collateral (USDC, ETH derivatives), generating yields from cross-chain deployments.

Strategy: Mint scUSD (Sonic-native stablecoin) by depositing stablecoins or ETH-based tokens, earning yield from Ethereum vaults via Veda, and redeploying scUSD for additional DeFi yields.

Estimated APR: ~10-20% (base yield from @veda_labs vaults, plus potential extra from scUSD deployment).

Steps:
â€¢ Bridge or obtain USDC/WETH to Sonic.
â€¢ Deposit collateral into Rings Protocol to mint scUSD (collateral earns yield via Ethereum-based Veda Labs vaults).
â€¢ Stake minted scUSD on Sonic or provide it as liquidity to DEX pools.
â€¢ Regularly collect yield distributed weekly by Rings.
â€¢ Earn Sonic Points passively and actively (6x multiplier).

3. Vicuna Finance: Leveraged Concentrated Liquidity

@VicunaFinance provides leverage for concentrated liquidity provision, amplifying yields in stable pairs.

Strategy: Use borrowed funds to provide leveraged liquidity to a concentrated pool (e.g., USDC/scUSD), amplifying trading fee yields.

Estimated APR: ~40-60% (15% base APR Ã— 3-4x leverage, before borrowing costs).

Steps:
â€¢ Deposit USDC as collateral on Vicuna.
â€¢ Leverage collateral (3-4x) to borrow additional stablecoins (scUSD or USDC).
â€¢ Provide leveraged liquidity into a concentrated stablecoin pool on Shadow or Beethoven X.
â€¢ Maintain collateral health and regularly harvest rewards.
â€¢ Earn Sonic Points for active liquidity.

Risks: Leveraged liquidation risk, interest rate fluctuations, impermanent loss in volatile markets.

4. Spectra Finance: Fixed-Rate Yield Vaults

@spectra_finance offers predictable, fixed-rate returns on stablecoin deposits through yield vaults, ideal for stable, lower-risk returns.

Strategy: Lock stablecoins for a fixed-rate yield, hedge against yield volatility, and earn additional LP rewards.

Estimated APR: ~12-18% (fixed rate + liquidity provision incentives).

Steps:
â€¢ Deposit stablecoins (USDC/scUSD) into Spectra's fixed-rate vaults, locking for durations (30â€“90 days).
â€¢ Optionally, boost earnings by providing liquidity to Spectraâ€™s interest rate trading pools.
â€¢ Collect predictable yields plus Sonic Points for active participation.

Risks: Lower flexibility due to lock-ups, potential opportunity cost during high market volatility.

5. Vertex Protocol: Perpetuals Yield Farming

@vertex_protocol combines spot markets, perpetual trading, and lending markets, allowing users to earn interest on stablecoin deposits and yield from perpetual futures.

Strategy: Deposit stablecoins into Vertexâ€™s money market to earn lending yield, then use borrowed funds to farm perpetuals trading rewards.

Estimated APR: ~15-25% (10% lending + 5-15% trading incentives).

Strategy Steps:
â€¢ Deposit USDC/scUSD into Vertex lending pool (base lending yield ~10%).
â€¢ Borrow $S or other tokens to trade perpetual futures on Vertex, leveraging funding rate arbitrage and additional rewards.
â€¢ Monitor positions closely for profitable exits and regular collateral management.
â€¢ Gain additional Sonic Points from active market participation.

Risks: Perpetual trading volatility, liquidation risk, fluctuations in funding rates.

2. What technical Improvements were done until now ?

ğŸ”¹ STARK Proof on Bitcoin Testnet: StarkWare successfully verified a STARK proof on Bitcoin testnet, just as they do on Ethereum. This marks the first step toward scaling Bitcoin.

ğŸ”¹ Optimizing Arithmetic Operations for STARKs: By optimizing how mathematical operations are performed, it makes STARK proof verification cheaper and less resource-intensive which reduces cost fees and increase the transaction speed

ğŸ”¹ Verifier Efficiency Enhancement: Thanks to a new method Starkware makes the process of checking mathematical computations within STARK proofs faster and more resource-efficient. This is improving speed and reducing cost fees.

ğŸ”¹ SHA256 Optimization for Bitcoin Script: With this optimization SHA256 hashing (a key part of Bitcoin's security) work faster and with fewer resources within Bitcoin's limited scripting environment.

â€¢ 28% fewer operations â†’ Makes SHA256 computations faster, reducing execution time.

â€¢ 26% less memory usage â†’ Optimizes resource consumption, allowing SHA256 to function more efficiently within Bitcoinâ€™s limited scripting environment.

â†’ This lower cost and resource usage.

ğŸ”¹ Covenants Without Soft Forks: By implementing covenants without a soft fork, Bitcoin can gain more advanced features while avoiding the need for a controversial network upgrade. While the current implementation is slow and expensive, it demonstrates that these features can be added securely to Bitcoin's framework

ğŸ”¹ L2 Bridge Between Starknet and Bitcoin: In collaboration with sCrypt, StarkWare introduced a proof-of-concept (PoC)  bridge on Bitcoin Signet to enable secure and decentralized interactions. This is a massive milestone toward a trustless L2 solution, promoting interoperability and for more use cases for both @Starknet and Bitcoin.

3. Lightning Network and Its Limitations

The Lightning Network is a Layer 2 scaling solution built on top of the Bitcoin blockchain that aims to make transactions faster and cheaper. It enables instant, low-cost transactions by creating off-chain payment channels between users.

The Lightning Network was created to allows Bitcoin to be used for smaller, everyday transactions like buying a coffee or paying for a service, which would be impractical due to Bitcoinâ€™s high transaction fees and slow processing times.

While Lightning improves Bitcoin for small payments, it has limitations:

ğŸ”¹ Liquidity Issues: Users must lock up Bitcoins in channels, limiting capital efficiency.

ğŸ”¹ Routing payments between users can fail if liquidity is insufficient.

ğŸ”¹ It only supports simple transactions, not smart contracts or DeFi applications. So basically you send Bitcoin from Wallet A to Wallet B, and thatâ€™s all !

With Lightning Network only, Bitcoin cannot integrate broader economy features like DeFi.

But what if Bitcoin could scale beyond just payments ? What if bitcoin could enter the world of decentralized applications?

Thatâ€™s where @Starknet comes in !

4âƒ£ For Bitcoin Network:

Bitcoinâ€™s current throughput is widely unsufficient to become the world payment system !

Starknet, can scale bitcoin to 1 million transactions per second making Satoshiâ€™s vision of Bitcoin as a world payment method a reality!

With lower fees and faster transactions, Starknet give access to Bitcoin, to the 1.5 billion unbanked individuals in the world to participate in the global economy.

6. Why Bitcoin Maxis Should Care ?

â€¢ Satoshiâ€™s vision

Bitcoinâ€™s current scalability limitations stand in the way of it becoming a global payment system as Satoshi wanted !

Starknet gives a scalable solution that aligns with Satoshiâ€™s original vision, enabling Bitcoin to handle millions of transactions per second without compromising security.

No doubt that if Satoshi was still here, he would approve !

â€¢ Bitcoin Relevance

Right now, Bitcoin utility is limited to a digital gold.

But Starknet makes it more relevant for the decades to come by ensuring Bitcoin can adapt to a growing decentralized economy.

â€¢ Innovation with Integrity

Starknet can scale Bitcoin without compromising its decentralized principles.

Actually if OP_CAT was initially removed it was for security issue only. Starknet removes these security issues, making OP_CAT totally relevant to the current economy.

The integration provides tools for innovation, such as DeFi, private transactions, and self-custodial solutions, all built with respect for Bitcoinâ€™s foundational values.

The future of crypto is not about competition but integration. Bitcoin remains the ultimate store of value, but it lacks flexibility.

In the other hand, Ethereum has the most advanced dApp ecosystem, but it needs more liquidity. Starknet can bridge this gap, allowing Bitcoin to scale without sacrificing security while connecting to Ethereumâ€™s financial application: The best of both world !

Now, Imagine:

â€¢ Bitcoin as a first-class DeFi asset

â€¢ Trustless swaps between Bitcoin and ETH at near-zero cost with near instant transaction

â€¢ Bitcoin-native dApps built with Cairo and deployed on Starknet

â€¢ Institutional adoption of Bitcoin beyond just holding, it can be used productively

The economy system is set to evolve with time. Bitcoin and Ethereum together on Starknet is only a natural evolution. It has to happen !

Letâ€™s make Bitcoin and Ethereum GREATER !

Thank you, dear Meeera & Sameer Jain, for having me / Leverage over at the @EconomicTimes Corporate Excellence Awards. Having only read about it since I was a school kid, felt quite the deal to attend it this very first time. And what spectacular show it was âœ¨ ğŸ§š 

Was great to meet some early Leverage believers, some old friends in the startup land, and some others who Iâ€™ve wanted to meet for the longest time. To top it, the event had an incredible dose of inspiration, top to bottom, pure fuel! 

My top three moments:
- when N Chandrasekaran came to share some words about Bharatâ€™s jewel, Sir Ratan Tata, he recalled the time when heâ€™d made a request to renovate Bombay House, and Mr. Tataâ€™s response, after a few moments, was â€œwhere will the dogs goâ€ â€¦. It pierced right through, something I deeply desire to achieve in life 
- one of our own, Peyush Bansal of Lenskart, also an early believer in Leverage, winning the Entrepreneur of Year award, and his wifeâ€™s note following that; its powering because it somehow signals that â€œif we work hard enough, we will get thereâ€
- Business Leader of the Year, Kumar Mangalam Birla Sirâ€™s note, when he almost choked up .. Iâ€™ve (by his good grace) had the chance to meet him a couple times in the last few years, but wouldnâ€™t have ever reckoned him getting a tad emotional, and rightly so though, the impact â€œjust he has hadâ€ on the Birla Group, over last 30 years, that ability to survive and continue to win irrespective how many times they write you off, is so so powerful!

SambaNova just launched the fastest DeepSeek-R1 671B.

It's 300% faster than the latest GPUs. How? RDUs.

RDUs (reconfigurable dataflow units) are purpose-built from the ground up for AI.

They're not retrofitted like GPUs which were originally built for graphics rendering.

The SN40L RDU that SambaNova released is the fastest and highest-efficiency processor currently available.

And this is great news for us developers. 

A single SN40L chip can hold hundreds of models (trillions of parameters) in memory!

The speed is a huge deal.

But the even bigger advantage is for agentic workflows running multiple specialized models.

GPUs can only process one model at a time, slowing down workflows that require multiple models to interact. SN40L removes that bottleneck, making multi-agent AI dramatically faster.

If you've been running the latest models, you know that inference speed has become a huge bottleneck.

And having to run smaller distilled versions is far from ideal.

With SambaNova's SN40L chip we can run versions like DeepSeek-R1 671B without slow response times. And we can run other models simultaneously.

â†’ That means we can build and deploy fast agentic workflows

â†’ It also means access to more powerful and faster coding assistants.

Whether you're deploying Llama, the latest DeepSeek models, or agentic workflows, SambaNova gives you a cloud-based playground to test, fine-tune, and deploy models at speed.

Create an account on SambaNova and use DeepSeek-R1 671B or Llama 3.1 405B here: https://t.co/a80lEZl2US

ğŸ“±Big Tech & Startups

Manus, a New AI Agent From China is Going Viralâ€”And Raising Big Questions 
Manus is an autonomous agent that can analyze, plan, and execute tasks on its own. It is currently only accessible through invitation codes, which are in short supply - demand is through the roof as the AI community is raving about its capabilities. Many are now asking whether China has leapfrogged the US in AI. Manus likely achieved its impressive capabilities through innovative fine-tuning rather than core model innovation. A video introducing Manus is available in the article.

Apple Delays Siri Upgrade Indefinitely as AI Concerns Escalate 
Apple is delaying updates to Siri for the foreseeable future. The company's engineers believe that the features introduced last June won't be released until next year at the earliest. Several executives have voiced strong concerns as the features didn't work as advertised in their personal testing. Apple may have to rebuild the features from scratch.

ğŸš€Science & Futuristic Technology

Natural alternative to Ozempic brings results without side effects 
Stanford scientists have identified a naturally occurring molecule that works like semaglutide, producing weight loss and improved glucose and insulin tolerance, when tested in mice and minipigs. The peptide, named BRP, only works in the brain, as opposed to semaglutide, which has widespread effects. It specifically acts in the hypothalamus, which controls appetite and metabolism, which could be an improvement over semaglutide. The scientists intend to move to human clinical trials for BRP.

Starship Flight 8: SpaceX nails Super Heavy booster catch but loses upper stage 
SpaceX's eight Starship test flight last Thursday aimed for the third successful booster recovery and the deployment of a satellite simulator. While the Super Heavy booster returned successfully to Starbase's launch tower, the mission's upper stage disintegrated during its flight. SpaceX has been reviewing the data from the flight to better understand the incident's root cause. Video of the explosion is available in the article.

ğŸ’»Programming, Design & Data Science

Building an Agentic System (Website)
This site provides a practical deep dive and code review into how to build a self-driving coding agent, execution engine, tools, and commands. It focuses on the systems and design decisions that go into making agents that are real-time, self-corrective, and useful for productive work. The site provides documentation on every tool and command it covers, as well as implementation details. It covers the underlying patterns that make real-time AI coding assistants feel responsive, safe, and genuinely useful.

pg_mooncake ğŸ¥® (GitHub Repo)
pg_mooncake is a Postgres extension that adds columnar storage and vectorized execution for fast analytics. It ranks among the top 10 fastest on ClickBench. pg_mooncake supports loading data from Postgres heap tables, Parquet, CSV, and JSON files, Iceberg and Delta Lake tables, and Hugging Face datasets.

ğŸMiscellaneous

Microsoft's Relationship With OpenAI Is Not Looking Good
More evidence has surfaced that Microsoft is looking to split with OpenAI. Microsoft is developing its own in-house reasoning models and has been testing models from xAI, Meta, and DeepSeek to replace ChatGPT in Copilot. Copilot has so far been received poorly in enterprise due to its high cost and limited results. OpenAI and Microsoft are quickly becoming competitors, so it makes sense that the companies would want to detach from each other. Microsoft has an interest in controlling the technologies and writing its own destiny.

Meta Takes Another Hit After Reports That It Blacklists Ex-Employees 
Meta reportedly maintains a de facto blacklist of ex-employees - even some former workers with sterling track records have been blocked. The company uses multiple systems to track rehire ineligibility, but the exact mechanisms and number of affected employees are unclear. While the blacklist may not sit well with outsiders, it is not illegal. The routine banishment of ex-workers isn't exclusive to Meta, with Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and many other companies purportedly maintaining similar lists.

BINANCE GIVES USERS POWER TO VOTE ON TOKEN LISTINGS AND DELISTINGS

- Binance, the world's largest centralized exchange, is shifting its token listing strategy by introducing community co-governance.

- The move allows users to vote on which tokens should be listed or delisted, giving them a direct role in shaping Binanceâ€™s offerings.

Key Highlights:

- Users can vote for projects they want listed. Those with the most support and passing due diligence will be added.

- Users can also vote to remove tokens that lack development, have inactive teams, or pose risks.

- In recent months, Binance introduced new ways for projects to list, including Launchpool, Megadrop, and Pre-Market Trading.

- With Binanceâ€™s Alpha Observation Zone, early-stage projects get exposure before full listing approval.

Why It Matters:

- Crypto markets are flooded with new tokens, so exchanges are looking to refine their selection process.

- CoinMarketCap data shows crypto projects surged from 11 million to 12.4 million in weeks. A rapid influx of tokens raises concerns about quality and market fragmentation.

- Even Coinbase is rethinking its listing process, as CEO Brian Armstrong noted that 1 million tokens are created every weekâ€”making manual reviews unsustainable.

- This shift in governance could change how centralized exchanges manage token listings, giving users more power while maintaining quality control.

Image: Binance X platform

In my view, the biggest challenge Lido is facing is Ethereumâ€™s decentralization requirement. In PoS chains, stakers play a crucial role in consensus formation.

Ethereumâ€™s ecosystem is strict about maintaining decentralization, especially since @LidoFinance  accounts for 8% of the total staked Ethereum. This has led to discussions about limiting Lidoâ€™s growth.

The Ethereum Foundation is also adjusting staking mechanisms to prevent the emergence of an overly dominant staking entity. Although Ethereumâ€™s staking rate is still below 30% (28%), it remains significantly lower than other major PoS chains like $SOL (65%), $ADA (60%), and $SUI (77%).

However, the Ethereum team has repeatedly expressed concerns about excessive ETH staking and has proposed capping the staking ratio at a maximum of 30%. This limits Lidoâ€™s future growth potential.

Additionally, in the current market cycle, where ETH is underperforming, $LDO faces challenges due to its business modelâ€™s strong reliance on ETHâ€™s price.

That said, as long as the current amount of staked ETH is maintained, Lido still generates a weekly gross profit ranging from $750,000 to $1.5 million.

With a more favorable regulatory environment and the protocol set to achieve â€œprofitabilityâ€ in accounting terms by 2024, the core team has begun discussing linking protocol revenue to $LDO in their 2025 plans.

If the US legalizes liquid staking, Lido could greatly benefit as institutional capital enters the staking market.

Therefore, we can expect that in 2025, $LDO will start receiving income from protocol staking. In conclusion, for these reasons, I still believe that $LDO is a strong long-term investment.

NEW BRAIN CELLS DISCOVEREDâ€”COULD THEY REVERSE ALZHEIMERâ€™S?

UBC researchers just identified "ovoid cells," a previously unknown neuron that helps the brain recognize and remember objects. 

These cells fire when we encounter something new, playing a critical role in long-term memory.

Dr. Mark Cembrowski and PhD student Adrienne Kinman believe these cells could be the missing link in Alzheimerâ€™s and epilepsy research. 

If scientists can control their activity, it may be possible to slow or even reverse cognitive decline.

This discovery upends decades of neuroscience and opens the door to groundbreaking treatments for memory-related diseases.

BINANCE TERMINATES MARKET MAKER OVER IRREGULAR TRADING ON GPS & SHELL

- Binance officially delisted a market maker accused of unethical trading practices involving GoPlus Security $GPS and MyShell $SHELL tokens.

Hereâ€™s what we know:

The Issue:

- The market maker was found to have engaged in irregular trading, specifically manipulating the price of GPS by selling off large quantities of tokens right after their trading went live on Binance.

- The GPS price initially skyrocketed from $0.1304 to $0.2015, then plummeted to $0.08, reportedly causing massive losses for investors.

- Per reports, the market maker violated Binanceâ€™s rules by failing to maintain a fair order book, distorting buy and sell balance, neglecting liquidity requirements, and engaging in disruptive trading behavior.

Market Makerâ€™s Impact on SHELL

- During the investigation into GPS, Binance uncovered that the same market maker was also handling liquidity for MyShell ($SHELL).

- While the exact misconduct with SHELL is unclear, given the previous violations with GPS, Binance is now reviewing activities with this project as well.

Binanceâ€™s Immediate Actions:

To protect the integrity of the market and usersâ€™ interests, Binance took the following steps:

- Delisted the market maker from platform operations.
- Confiscated all illicit profits generated by the market maker.
- Announced plans to use seized profits for user compensation, with details to be shared by the respective projects, GoPlus and MyShell.

Project Teams Speak Out:

Both GoPlus Security and MyShell responded publicly to the incident:

- GoPlus Security ($GPS) Founder Mike acknowledged the mismanagement, apologized to the community, and promised to push for the repurchase of all sold GPS tokens by the market maker. He also clarified that the team itself has not sold any GPS tokens and that all team-held tokens can be tracked on-chain.

- MyShell ($SHELL) Co-founder Ethan Sun expressed regret over the situation and confirmed that the team terminated the market maker's services.

â€œWe are aware of the ongoing MM situation and have taken immediate action by terminating our service with the involved market maker,â€ Sun noted. â€œIn the meantime, we are working closely with Binance to implement a solution as soon as possible. Further details on our plan will be shared soon.â€

We recreated Polymarket on Scroll in under three weeks... all because we fucked up.

The real story? We started with a dream of building a lending protocol for Polymarketâ€”an idea I was shocked no one had tackled before, given the data. The math was obvious: traders NEED to lock up massive capital in prediction markets and hold positions until market close. That capital sits there, unutilized. Inefficient. Wasteful. For months.

But when we entered Scroll Open, we hit our first wall: we'd need to build on Scroll. Impossible to directly interface with Polymarket. So what did we do? We pivot. Hard.

We started with an idea, a prediction market. But not just any marketâ€”we wanted something new. A platform where financial participation drives real world outcomes. Think futarchy + prediction markets. We spent weeks on figuring out the system, ensuring there was no way to exploit it. It had the potential to deliver huge impact and it was something close to our hearts, it was transformative.

Then came the questions that every founder dreads: "How will you get users?" "Targeting regen & social impact seriously limits your TAM." "You won't scale." I wanted to ignore them. I tried to ignore them. But when the same feedback keeps hitting you from every direction, you have to listen.

So I looked at @Scroll_ZKP itselfâ€”objectively, brutally. The chain had hemorrhaged from $1B TVL down to $80M. 24h DEX volume? A mere $1M with only 5,000 active wallets in the past day. These weren't just numbers. This was a reality check. We went back to users and asked what they actually wanted in a prediction market. The answer was clear: rewards and unlocked liquidity.

That's when everything clicked. We'd build Polymarket on Scroll, but with our original innovation intact: integrated lending and borrowing. The first of its kind. A prediction market where your positions donâ€™t just sit there, they work for you.

With just two developersâ€”the same powerhouse builders who've brought countless products to life for our clients at @elvtd_io, we compressed what should have been months of work into mere weeks. We skipped building a CLOB because time was tight. But my team is beyond cracked. Huge shoutout to @cheekychain who created designs that are literally turning heads. We built. We tested. We iterated. We delivered.

And here's the most important thing I learned: We're not here just to win a hackathon. We're not building for 6 weeks. We're building for 6 months. For years. For the future. Because the true test of an entrepreneur isn't sticking stubbornly to your original visionâ€”it's having the courage to adapt when reality demands it. It's about building something that will last. That will scale. That will actually work.

So yes, we pivoted from our heart project. But in finding what the market actually needed, we discovered something even more powerful: a path to sustainable impact.

Prediction markets with $30M daily volume + integrated lending? That's not just a hackathon project. That's a protocol with staying power.

Immensely proud of what we've accomplished. Wildly excited for what's next. This isn't the end. It's barely the beginning. Donâ€™t fade @foresightnow.

It is easiest to raise capital when you don't need it.

This is true in a psychological sense [investors must be aggressive when you have the leverage] but there's a deeper reason too.

Your investors must believe that there is a decent chance they will make a ton of money by investing in your startup.

That requires having a clear path to a hugely successful business model. As in, you will get there no matter what, and accepting capital merely allows you to get there faster.

You want the debate in the IC to be about how fast you can grow, or what the challenges of scaling will be, or how durable the market is, or how hard it is for competitors to pivot and how big your lead is... not about whether there is a business there at all.

If your mentality is "I need a million dollars to build my idea to prove to everyone that this business works" then you are already in trouble. You need to get your startup to the point where you don't need money to prove that it works, it's just that more capital will help you scale up and accelerate.

In the early days it is extremely urgent to prove demand, to establish revenue, to iterate rapidly on both product and sales tactics, and to take what growth hacks are available, to make your startup feel unfuckwithable and inevitable.

â€œItâ€™s not about whoâ€™s the best, itâ€™s about whoâ€™s leftâ€

A quick story about training mma and winning in Crypto long-term.

Iâ€™ve been involved with various forms of combat sports for close to a decade. 4 years into it, I was ready to quit forever.

My injuries were starting to add up, my growth plateaued, and an 18 year old hotshot was beating me (and my ego) after only a few months of training.

I realized that talent was real, and that I wasnâ€™t talented in this area. Hmm...maybe Yoga would be better for me, and I could meet some babes.

At the end of class, my coach said something to that class that I'd never forget.

â€œItâ€™s not about whoâ€™s the best, itâ€™s about whoâ€™s leftâ€

What did he mean by this?

Thereâ€™s always going to be people who are more talented than you. But talent comes and goes. Whatâ€™s even rarer than talent is the guy who just keeps showing up. The person whoâ€™s consistent. 

The guy who eventually becomes the best is the one who keeps training.

This meant prioritizing recovery. This means putting down your EGO and not going 100% against the new kid and risking injury. This means investing in a strength & conditioning protocol so you can keep training long-term.

Right now Iâ€™m visiting my parents and stopped by my old mma gym. My coach is still there. The place still looks the same, although the gloves needs to be replaced. 

Thereâ€™s a new generation of people Iâ€™ve never seen before. Iâ€™m not as fast or as strong as I used to be. But I kept training the past decade, and letâ€™s just say Iâ€™m no longer the weakest at the gym.

Everyone from my generation is gone. Most of the people I thought were super talented quit a long time ago, or never fully recovered from injuries.

This story makes me think a lot about Crypto and survival.

If you just keep showing up, youâ€™ll get better. But that means you have to prioritize survival.

In the gym that meant not over-training, not letting my ego get the best of me, and training in a way that was sustainable in the long-term. Developing a game that would age well instead of fancy, athletic based movements.

What does this look like in Crypto?

â€¢ Taking profits even though youâ€™re bullish

â€¢ Increasing your long-term BTC stash

â€¢ Avoiding leverage and other ways that can â€œinjure youâ€

â€¢ Only playing when you have an advantage

â€¢ Instead of burning out, figuring out a way to be in Crypto that's more sustainable. Researching 3 hours a day everyday vs 14 hrs a day and burning out every few weeks. 

â€¢ Being comfortable leaving money on the table. Iâ€™m going shopping this week for some tokens. Iâ€™m ok with not getting the perfect entry - I just want to make sure I have exposure.

Thereâ€™s a glorification of the guys who made it in one cycle. 

Extreme survivorship bias - you'll hear about that guy but not the thousands of people who went busto trying to do the same thing.

Youâ€™ll make it if youâ€™re one of the last guys standing.

Itâ€™s easy to find top signals with the benefit of hindsight and to beat yourself up for not taking profits â€” especially if you made a lot of paper money on a memecoin or something junky

The reality is that very few people have the ability to make the crazy trades *and* sell at a good time

It takes a different set of skills and sensibilities to take the high risk route and have a portfolio do several multiples vs take the â€œsensibleâ€ and cautious route of profit taking and sticking to the safer coins (and stables)

And on top of it all, social media has a way of warping your perspective on everything

On the one hand when prices are going crazy your feed will show you people with insane PnL screenshots calling you dumb for not making explosive gains because of how â€œeasyâ€ it is, and on the other hand when prices crash your feed will show you people quote retweeting past posts talking about stabling up and calling you dumb for not taking profits

(Even if theyâ€™re not explicitly saying it, itâ€™s implied, and our brains have a way of making us feel bad)

No real takeaway here other than again.. donâ€™t be too hard on yourself

I, for one, round tripped a lot last cycle and am well on my way to round tripping a lot this cycle too. Iâ€™ve done better and taken more profit, but Iâ€™m far from perfect and am repeating many of the same mistakes again.

Can only hope to do better going forward

Thatâ€™s all any of us can hope for

Last thing â€” we all have a tendency of comparing ourselves to others, especially on this app. The only person you ought to compare yourself to is your past self. Thatâ€™s the only score that matters.

random thoughts/predictions on where vibe coding might go:

- most code will be written (generated?) by the time rich. Thus, most code will be written by kids/students rather than software engineers. This is the same trend as video, photos, and other social media

- we are in the command line interface days of vibe coding. For the majority of creators, vibe coding will eventually fade, and vibe designing (with a visual paradigm) will come to dominate. People ultimately think better in a GUI-like format than a CLI-like format. Thus, in vibe designing you will show the AI the design outcomes you want, and then everything else is done for you. Yes, you may end up with tools to tweak the design details for extra controllability, and provide additional mockups that then get filled in underneath with code. But maybe folks will build software without seeing or learning a programming language.

- vibe coding could reduce the need for open source libraries as more code will be generated from scratch by AI. Code will be more of a disposable commodity, with less reuse, and instead generated on the fly for personalized use. It's interesting to see right now that creating a new project is easier than editing a project, because the latter requires a lot more context/complexity. Interesting dynamics if something like this continues

- "trad UX" and design standards give way to post-modern/fragmented software, as millions of new vibe coders create experiences with no prior know how and new perspectives. New patterns will emerge, as TikTok/YouTube has done to film making and trad entertainment. The world will go beyond buttons and modals and scrollbars and other things. Software may become unrecognizable before it coalesces again

- if vibe coding makes software trivial to build, then the bottlenecks shift to other places: 1) consistent creativity that stays ahead of everyone else. Anyone can write a tweet, but the best creators are the ones who consistently come up with new ideas. 2) distribution and network effects, where the first vibe coded product doesn't win, but rather the first vibe coded product that hits scale that wins

- imagine products that automatically adapt based on user behavior, rather than based on the actions of the vibe coder. For example, if the vibe coder has specified that the signup funnel should easy, then after seeing users struggle with it, the software can automatically vibe code itself to improve the flow by dropping steps or adding explanatory text. Right now we are in a paradigm where PMs specify behavior that software engineers specify in code. Imagine if PMs can specify outcomes, and the software is configured to automatically adapt to hit those outcomes

The price action of the last week leads to awkward bag-holding.

You don't want to sell because it's already down a lot and/or you're tempted to wait for a bounce to reassess.

Simple test:

"If I didn't have a position, would I want the exposure I have now?"

Yes --> Cool, you're fine.

No --> Do something about it.

Active positions cost mental capital, which is a scarce resource.

You're less likely to spot and execute the next good trade if the current shit trade is eating away at you.

Unsolicited late night thoughts on how to fix the crypto venture financing / altcoin space.

1. Make '% of Company Reserve' meta again. 

In 2022, it was a lot more common to see private investors invest into projects and receive a % of Company Reserve v.s. % of FDV. This means when I invest 1m at 100m, I don't get 1% of total FDV. I get 1% of whatever the team supply is (so if its 20%, I get 0.2%). 

This creates a situation where investor and team are more aligned and far less tokens are being emitted.

This has fallen off a lot more recently although I still rarely see them with good projects and strong founders.

Sure, this means you will raise less money at lower vals which leads me to my next point.

2. Raise less, at lower valuations

Lets get real here. 90% of projects don't need 10m+ dollars pre-PMF to build a dApp or a chain. We all know half of you fork code and/or outsource most of your shit to Eastern Europe / SEA / LatAm anyway.

Raising at lower vals means you don't get pressure to launch at retarded vals where the only buyer is the MM you pay (using the 5m dollars you have left after exorbitant salaries and parties). 

3. Make the fair launch actually fair

If you are going to do a 'fair launch' make it actually fair. That means allowing everyone to participate on clearly defined parameters that are not based on who you know or how early you are.

Fair launch + getting an MM to snipe your own launch is retarded. Echo rounds where access is gated is retarded. Nobody wants to be someone else's exit liquidity because he knew a guy or got in early. 

4. Time based unlock for team makes zero sense

Why is the team's economics tied to an arbitrary period of time? Shouldn't it be correlated to... actually making the product work?

This disincentivizes all the market-making nonsense where a team basically just tries to manage token price until the unlocks happen.

5. The token is not the product

Founders need to build something actually useful that people want to use instead of simply paying KOLs to shill the token, TVL providers / liquid funds to counterfeit retail activity and market makers to play the same ponzi game that everyone is playing.

 6. Exchanges should moderate

I'm surprised that exchanges have generally participated in a race to the bottom by competing for listings rather than actually creating strict listing rules and sanctioning projects that do not abide.

Actually I'm not surprised because they get fat listing fees + the ponzi projects have the most volume thanks to a literal army of market makers.

Excited to welcome Dieter Buchler @dtrbchlr to the University of Alberta! We are bringing robotics and reinforcement learning together for an awesome, interactive, and experiential AI.

What's good about @pixels_online is regardless of market conditions we can still build and test our tech.  

The core of what we're working on is solving p2e at scale - clown me all you want - we're not there yet, but each month we're getting closer.  

We have been giving out rewards to users at scale and building out models & prediction on what happens when you give a reward to a certain segment / cohort of users. 
What we want to know are things like, if you are able to use rewards to increase revenue, to increase ARPPU, to decrease initial time to first monetization, to boost retention of certain cohorts? Can you start to build predict what users early on in the journey will convert?  

This tech works without crypto too. If you build these models you can them with fiat, stables, or any currency. 

How I kind of view p2e is basically through this framing: If you were able to boost certain metrics in your web2 game like retention, LTV, or k-factor by 20-30% how much more successful would it be? That's where p2e can be applied. 

Pixels has been able to increase it's reward efficiency from 28% to ~70% in the last 6 months - and to be honest the biggest thing in our way has been our core game. The core game is improving month-by-month, but what's interesting is we can also accelerate our progress by working with other games too.

We're already opening our tech & current models to other teams. What's interesting is that the ecosystem may have an even better chance to reach our goal of net revenue when working with other games even quicker.   

This tech that we're building will be able to generate other revenue streams outside of our main token - there are already other teams we're talking to that have willingness to pay.

Web3 offers other very interesting ways to tokenize this business model.  At the end of the day, we're building our own first-party games (new ones like our pets app on the way) - but the bigger picture is we're also building a new type of ad network.

What we're building is kind of like an ad network where we reward users to participate in good / positive ecosystem behavior.  

Regardless of how you feel about core pixels & state of the game - (believe me we love Core Pixels and are dedicated to making it as good as we possibly can) - there is also something bigger here that we're building - this tech is important, has real value, and people are willing to pay for it.

Teams that build things of real value are not going anywhere in the long-run. Clown us in the short-term if you want but teams that are persistent in building real things will win.

You don't have to believe in what we're doing - but I do & will keep building ğŸ«¡

The fact that â€œMEVâ€ infra is the most funded thing on that chain right now is literal evidence of that.

In 2023, Ethereum was criticized by podcasters because there was too much focus on MEV and scaling infra by VCs.

In 2021, the solana narrative was that It didnâ€™t have evil extractive MEV like ethereum does, that blocks were produced so fast that the demand for ordering preference just magically evaporates. 

This was literally touted by sol leadership and others in crypto media.

Today, the entire value prop and narrative for solana is that you stake SOL to earn MEV. 

They went from saying MEV is evil and doesnâ€™t exist on solana to building the entire ecosystem on top of it. They even try to rally behind a new (rather unoriginal) name for MEV as if it erases this history.

In 2020 Ethereum created a ton of net new use cases and open source protocols that are the basis and foundation of all onchain applications that exist today, on all chains, regardless of the VM being used.

But for the past year, nearly all the activity on Solana has been purely extractive, with little produced value for the industry.

Nearly 2 years into my transition to being an investor, a few notes:

- My 1 liner of what I look for: exceptional founders building something radical (that people want). Radical companies feel a bit strange; what feels normal is usually territory for incumbents.

- The epitaph for my career as a founder is that I cared more about ideas than customers. It's hard for me to get excited by founders who seem likely to make my mistakes. It's not a movie I like to rewatch.

- The companies I've gotten most excited about are not companies that reaffirm my theses (I'm pretty self-conscious about confirmation bias) but the ones that manage to change my mind. 

- I think we under-appreciate how exceptional the best founders are. I think a lot about Brian Scalibrine: "I'm way closer to Lebron than you are to me". 

-  Talent vs. access. If you don't have Sequoia's access, you better hope you can mine talent in places they're not looking. As talent becomes more legible (Thiel fellowship, Prod, YC) it becomes harder to compete against firms that have better access.

Hyperliquid = HyperCore + HyperEVM.

One piece of user feedback since HyperEVMâ€™s alpha launch was to more intuitively communicate how the HyperEVM fits into the larger context of Hyperliquid. To this effect, the native pieces of the Hyperliquid execution state have been organized under one umbrella term: HyperCore.

HyperCore consists of performant native components: order book perp and spot DEX, staking, oracles, multi-sig, etc. HyperEVM is a general purpose world-computer, allowing builders to deploy code that interacts with both HyperEVM and HyperCore. Together, they form one global, composable state on Hyperliquid, secured by the state-of-the-art HyperBFT consensus algorithm. Importantly, any interaction across the Core/EVM boundary is part of execution itself. There is one unified state, with no need for bridging, proofs, or trusted signers.

HyperEVM offers builders a familiar interface to plug into the most powerful permissionless financial system in crypto. Let's walk through some concrete examples.

A project XYZ deploys an ERC20 contract on the HyperEVM using standard EVM tooling. They deploy a corresponding spot asset XYZ permissionlessly in the HyperCore ticker auction. Once the XYZ HyperCore token and HyperEVM contract are linked, users can seamlessly transfer their XYZ balance to HyperCore for order book trading. Two key improvements compared to CEX listings:

1) The entire process is permissionless. No behind-the-scenes negotiations for preferential treatment. Hyperliquid is a neutral platform for finance.
2) There is no bridging risk between HyperCore and HyperEVM. On the other hand, CEXs need to manage deposits and withdrawals through wallets that could be hacked. HyperCore and HyperEVM are one unified state.
Trading and building on the same chain is a 10x product improvement over CEXs.

Let's go further. A lending protocol sets up a pool contract that accepts XYZ as collateral and lends out another token ABC to the borrower. To determine the liquidation threshold, the lending smart contract can read XYZ/ABC prices directly from the HyperCore order books using a "read precompile." For a Solidity developer, this is as simple as calling a built-in function.

Suppose the borrower's position requires liquidation. The lending smart contract can send orders directly swapping XYZ and ABC on the HyperCore order books using a "write precompile." Again, this is a simple built-in function in Solidity. In a few lines of code, the lending protocol has implemented protocolized liquidations similar to how perps function on HyperCore. A theme of the HyperEVM is to abstract away the deep liquidity on HyperCore as a building block for arbitrary user applications.

As these interactions become available on mainnet HyperEVM, I look forward to seeing the innovative ways that builders leverage these primitives to reinvent finance. These examples only scratch the surface of what is possible.

ELON: I STRONGLY RECOMMEND STUDYING PHYSICS

â€œI studied physics, and I certainly strongly recommend physics as a good grounding to understand the nature of reality.

Physics is fundamentally just understanding how the universe actually works. 

That's a good foundation for a variety of engineering disciplines. 

The analytical constructs used in physics [like first-principles thinking] apply to basically anything. 

Most people tend to think by analogy or by comparison with something that already exists. 

This is a mental shortcut that requires less brain strain, but it's hard to get fundamental insights unless you think about things from a first-principles standpoint.â€

Transcription of Ye and Ansem's conversation.

Ye: Okay so what were you telling me about? 

Ansem: So blockchains are essentially like global app stores where anybody can permissionlessly create their own applications and essentially get access to a ton of liquidity globally from people all over the world. 

Take Apple. You can get approval to get in the app store and then Apple takes a cut off all the revenue of your app.

With something like Solana, if you build an app on Solana, there's nobody who will take a cut. 

You can build whatever you want to build and immediately access everyone who has a crypto wallet. 

And anybody can make a crypto wallet at any point in time.

And then the second thing I was saying as far as connecting your community to crypto... 

You said what do you want your legacy to be, what do you want your biggest focus to be. And you said you want to build community. 

I'd say that very closely relates to crypto because right now you have a ton of fans in your own world. You know this. 

But there's no way to say who is my number one engaged fan.

$BTC Has traded around this area with a lot of volatility.

It currently sits on top of the Daily 200MA/EMA but below the previous range low around ~$90K.

You could say the market is very undecisive at this area after all the headlines that had to be digested.

I think whatever move comes from here will be decisive for the following couple of weeks of trending price action.

Above ~$90K and holding there, and I think we re-visit the all time high. This would be in line with previous consolidations, range breakdowns & retakes.

Below ~$80K and holding there (can be a wick as we saw before) would show a lot of weakness. In that case I think we can start looking for the previous range high test at the ~$74K region. This isn't my main scenario but it's something to keep in mind.

For now, we'll simply wait for either of these levels to be broken and for the market to show its hand.

On this day, 32 years ago, Eric Hughes published â€˜A Cypherpunkâ€™s Manifestoâ€™.

â€˜We must defend our own privacy if we expect to have any. We must come together and create systems which allow anonymous transactions to take place.â€™

Weâ€™ve come a long way.. and there is still much to do.

been thinking deeply about leverage latelyâ€”especially the illusion of titles.

people chase roles, levels, and positions thinking it gives them leverage, but thatâ€™s constant leverage: predictable, fixed floors of power, status, and expectations. comfortableâ€”but fragile, since someone always wants your spot.

iâ€™ve found something better: variable leverage. no title, no level, no fixed expectationsâ€”just pure agency. move fast, execute freely, hit goals. no oversight needed when youâ€™re clear on outcomes. this setup feels chaotic to others, but itâ€™s where i thrive best.

ironically, variable leverage often beats constant leverage at its own game. u donâ€™t need formal power to make big things happenâ€”just clarity, speed, autonomy and trust.

compensation? still proportional to performanceâ€”titles donâ€™t always dictate your worth.

and the best part about variable leverage: you can apply it anywhere. youâ€™re never trapped.

titles can hold you back. leverage wisely.

Preimage search is stateless, and therefore this step is a Poisson process allocating the expectation of success to searchers in proportion to their hash rate. It is also embarrassingly parallelizable, meaning that the searcher with the cheaper electricity bill (whether due to energy-efficient hardware or availability of cheap electricity) has a marginal advantage over the searcher with the more expensive one. All other things equal, preimage search favors searchers with access to cheap electricity. The geographical distribution of cheap power is the physical decentralization that underpins the virtual decentralization of the cryptocurrency that utilizes it.

Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) is pushing to bring its Arrow missile defense system to the United States, following Trumpâ€™s executive order to build a national missile defense shield.

 IAI CEO Boaz Levy:

How to get a job in web3

This is the only resource you will need to get a job in crypto

There are 2 ways to get a job: 

1) The conventional way: Applying with CV etc
2) The smarter way: Growing your network

Let's discuss both

1) The conventional way:

- You fix your CV, tailor it for every application, and apply to as many jobs as possible.

- The problem? Competition is insane. You're up against thousands of others. Unless you have a standout portfolio or direct connections, youâ€™ll probably get ghosted.

You can still use this method. If you're going this route, here are the best crypto job listing platforms:

a) cryptojobslist com (more defi related, startup and inferiorish jobs too)
b) jobs a16z com (more high end and US compensations.)
c) web3 career
d) remote3 co
e) cryptocurrencyjobs co/web3/ 
f) wellfound com/jobs 
g) jobs solana com/jobs

Now let's discuss the Smarter way

2) The smarter way:

Your network is your net worth: but not in the clichÃ© way. 

The people you engage with daily will determine the opportunities you get. Hereâ€™s how you actually build that network and make yourself valuable:

1) Start doing the work before you get hired

- Get your hands dirty: yield farming, airdrops, testnets, trading, NFTs - whatever part of the industry interests you.

- Share your process. Post consistently. Break down what you learn. Help others understand it.

2)  Learn fundamentals while building your presence

- The more you know, the more valuable your content becomes.

- Go deep. Understand the mechanics, and your insights will stand out.

- The better your fundamentals, the more prepared youâ€™ll be when the right opportunity comes. Learn the basics of blockchain, how PoW and PoS work under the hood, learn basics of defi, how AMMs work, how to do R:R for yield farming etc. Get your hands dirty and keep learning

3) Monetize while you learn

- Platforms like Kaito pay for posting. Some of their leaderboards (Polkadot, Skate, Quai, Lombard, Infinex, etc.) reward top contributions.

- Pick a leaderboard, spend time studying the tech, and start writing about it.

- You get paid, you build expertise, and you grow your presence - all at the same time.

4) Engage with the right people

- Find the key community members of projects youâ€™re interested in. 

- Go to project's kaito leaderboard, go over the accounts, and start connecting and replying to some of those guys and other community members, to integrate into that community.

- Join discussions, reply to their posts, and add value.

- When youâ€™re consistently visible in a niche, opportunities will start coming to you.

5) Results

Thus you will increase your media presence, improve your writing skills, and improve your fundamentals. 

Plus you will potentially get the rewards from Kaito.  

And the connections you will get will help land some entry level web3 jobs like discord mod. That experience, connections, and knowledge will prepare you more for better jobs.

Why this works:

A few weeks after I started consistently posting quality content on twitter, I got a job offer. Thatâ€™s how crypto hiring actually happens: through visibility and reputation.

Your first opportunity might be a community role like Discord mod, but thatâ€™s a start. From there, youâ€™ll gain experience, get connection, and level up into better jobs.

Most people fail because they give up too early. The ones who keep learning, posting, and engaging eventually find the right fit.

This is the long game. Play it right, and youâ€™ll attract job offers instead of chasing them.

I have to be honest: 
a huge part of why people are pushing AI and by extension, crypto-based AI agents infra is because thereâ€™s money to be made.

It feels like a new wave of tech frenzy, with fresh projects and ICOs and IPOs emerging almost daily. The growth of AI combined with crypto agents will depend heavily on the capital that flows into these projects. 

Once the hype is over, everything dumps. 

Iâ€™m not saying these technologies lack value or canâ€™t evolve, but I do worry they could tighten the grip of â€œBig Techâ€ and large-scale corporate interests on our everyday lives. 

I realize this comparison might not be perfect, but Iâ€™m already seeing less original content on social media platforms like Instagram and TikTok. Instead, thereâ€™s been a surge in reaction videos to other peopleâ€™s material. Sure, they can be funny or entertaining, but they also point to a growing complacency. Maybe thats why a platform like KAITO and YAPs work so well.

By way of background, Iâ€™ve bought my crypto in the web3 space since 2018. Iâ€™ve built a few AI chatbots on my own, and my current startup uses AI to aggregate and validate genuine investors and startup connections. Iâ€™ve also invested in multiple A.I. and web3 blockchain ventures, and I worked at a blockchain AGI company for the past year. Iâ€™m fortunate to have sold and exited my first startup about eight years ago. Even now, helping under stealth on a Web3 AI project.

Now, as I look to the future, Iâ€™m worried about what this all means for things like essays, papers, and even our childrenâ€™s writing skills. Good writing has always been a challenge, and the rise of â€œauto-generatedâ€ solutions only makes it more vulnerable. Are we undermining genuine learning? Is critical thinking more important now than ever?

Some of you might dismiss this as a typical â€œGen Xâ€ perspective (Iâ€™m in my 30s). You might think Iâ€™m clinging to the past or lack vision for the future. Thatâ€™s not the case at all. I see tremendous potential for AI whether itâ€™s robotics, predictive analytics, or algorithmic advancements. I also love how my Spotify and Youtube save me time and introduce me to new stuff. 

Iâ€™m not burying my head in the sand when it comes to the capabilities of AI and crypto; I just worry about the erosion of genuine creativity and content creation. If weâ€™re not careful, these technologies that are supposed to liberate us could wind up diminishing the very skills and originality that make us human.

Summary of Joshua D. Tobkinâ€™s AutoFi Thread
On March 6, 2025, at 04:45 UTC, Joshua D. Tobkin, associated with Supra, introduced AutoFi, a groundbreaking concept for decentralized finance (DeFi) on blockchains, particularly within Supraâ€™s Layer 1 (L1) ecosystem. AutoFi represents a paradigm shift in blockchain revenue generation, moving away from traditional reliance on transaction fees and token inflation toward a self-sustaining financial engine powered by automated arbitrage and liquidations at the protocol level.

This summary explores the key ideas, technical details, economic implications, and community reactions to AutoFi within the broader context of DeFi and blockchain economics.

1. Introduction to AutoFi: A New DeFi Paradigm
Tobkin opens by questioning whether blockchains can generate substantial revenue without relying on transaction fees and whether Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) botsâ€”which manipulate transaction ordering for profitâ€”can be eliminated. He presents AutoFi as the solution: an automated system that captures value typically extracted by MEV bots and redistributes it within the ecosystem.

Revenue Distribution:

25% to dApps: Funds DeFi innovation by creating a new revenue stream for builders.

25% to Validators: Pays validators through automation profits instead of inflation or MEV extraction.

50% to the Network Treasury: Strengthens the blockchainâ€™s financial position, enabling growth and liquidity without inflation.

By eliminating fee dependence, MEV middlemen, and inflationary mechanics, AutoFi positions blockchains as economically unstoppable financial engines.

2. Problems with Traditional Blockchain Models
Tobkin critiques the current blockchain revenue model, identifying three major flaws:

Unpredictable and Insufficient Fees â€“ Transaction fees fluctuate with network activity, making them unreliable.
MEV Extraction â€“ MEV bots drain millions from users, creating unfairness and centralization risks.
Inflationary Pressure â€“ Many L1s issue new tokens to sustain operations, diluting token value.
He argues this model is unsustainable, setting the stage for AutoFi as a transformative alternative.

3. How AutoFi Works: Technical and Economic Innovations

AutoFi internalizes revenue through automated DeFi mechanisms:

Auto-Arbitrage: Captures price inefficiencies across markets, removing MEV bots from the equation.
Auto-Liquidations: Executes liquidations efficiently, ensuring DeFi system stability.

Same-Block Execution: Transactions, including arbitrage and liquidations, settle within a single block, minimizing MEV opportunities.

This revenue is then redistributed to dApps, validators, and the network treasury, aligning incentives across the ecosystem.

AutoFiâ€™s economic impact includes:

Validators earn sustainable revenue without MEV reliance.

dApps gain a new revenue model beyond swaps or yield farming.

The Network Treasury builds a high-frequency revenue engine, funding ecosystem expansion without inflation.
This "flywheel effect" creates momentumâ€”more activity drives more revenue, improving execution, fueling further growth, and reducing reliance on external funding.

4. AutoFiâ€™s Broader Implications for DeFi and Blockchain Economics

AutoFiâ€™s introduction carries major implications for the blockchain industry:

Economic Sustainability â€“ Replaces fee-based and inflationary models with an automated revenue engine, reducing volatility.

Fairness & Equity â€“ Eliminates extractive MEV practices, making DeFi more inclusive and efficient.

Innovation & Adoption â€“ Encourages dApp development and validator participation, accelerating growth.
Competitive Edge â€“ Positions Supra ahead of Ethereum, Solana, and other L1s still struggling with MEV and fee issues.

5. Community Reactions
The thread received enthusiastic engagement from the crypto community, highlighting its potential:

@kryp_carlos: "Are we still going to the moon? ğŸš€ğŸš€" â†’ Tobkin responds, reinforcing Supraâ€™s trajectory.
@cryptoexpo2024: Calls AutoFi an "ambitious DeFi concept", highlighting its potential to capture MEV for the ecosystem.
@mickey_web3: Emphasizes AutoFiâ€™s ability to remove MEV actors while enhancing fair execution and rewards.
@MangPwit: Praises Supraâ€™s vision, predicting value appreciation for $SUPRA.
These reactions validate AutoFiâ€™s game-changing potential, reinforcing its disruptive nature in DeFi.

6. Conclusion
Joshua D. Tobkin presents AutoFi as a revolutionary shift in blockchain economics, turning automated arbitrage and liquidations into a sustainable financial engine.

By capturing MEV revenue and redistributing it to dApps, validators, and the treasury, AutoFi eliminates reliance on fees or inflation, making Supra a self-sustaining economic powerhouse.

With strong community backing and a bold vision, AutoFi could drive mass adoptionâ€”though challenges in execution, governance, and industry adoption remain.

As of March 2025, AutoFi positions Supra as a leader in the DeFi Revolution, offering a new blueprint for blockchain financial systems.

Yesterday, President Trump and Bestie David Sacks hosted a Crypto Summit at the White House, further affirming his administration's support for cryptocurrencies.

The President issued an executive order establishing two initiatives: the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, intended to hold seized Bitcoin indefinitely without selling, and a digital asset stockpile for other cryptocurrencies like Ethereum and XRP, which can be managed or sold by the Treasury.

The Trump administration plans to revise and reintroduce the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act (FIT21), which would define whether tokens are regulated by the SEC or CFTC. 

Stablecoins emerged as a key topic at the summit, with the administration viewing them as a path to maintaining U.S. dollar hegemony.

Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick indicated that U.S. dollar stablecoins should be fully backed by U.S. Treasuries and regularly audited, which could accelerate global adoption.

President Trump concluded the summit by declaring that the U.S. will be "the Bitcoin superpower."

I round tripped 8 figures last cycle. A few things I learned:

- Itâ€™s almost always better to sell too early and miss out on gains, then to hold too long and round trip the bag. This is because eventually, almost everything trends to zero, so even your â€œearly sellâ€ is likely going to make you look like a genius in a few months/years

- If you ever take a PnL screenshot of how much youâ€™re up, sell. You donâ€™t have to sell your entire position, but itâ€™s usually an excellent time to at least trim 20-50% of it.

- Most people on this app have absolutely no idea what theyâ€™re talking about. Often the loudest and most confident voices know the least, while the quiet and self questioning ones are full of wisdom.

- You canâ€™t borrow conviction. If you buy something because someone else did or told you it was â€œa hidden gemâ€, youâ€™re almost guaranteed to fumble the bag. Theyâ€™ll dump on your head while youâ€™re still anxiously waiting for their next tweet or YouTube video to tell you what to do.

- Stop trying to impress people. This is just good general life advice, but it applies triply so to this space. Wanting to impress your friends and family is one thing, wanted to impress random anons on the internet? Insanity.

- Thereâ€™s Bitcoin, and then thereâ€™s everything else. It took me too long to truly realize this. Yes alts can and will occasionally outperform - sometimes for long stretches of time - but basically everything bleeds to Bitcoin over the long run. 

- Most people try to outperform Bitcoin by trading these alts; probably leas than 5% of people can actually accomplish this. Itâ€™s like trying to outperform the S&P 500. Most people are better off just buying the index.

- This place has a way of warping your perspective to a level that is literally bordering on mental illness. Many of us refused to sell jpegs of a list of words for $50,000 last cycle because we thought â€œitâ€™s undervaluedâ€. Many otherwise smart people. You are not immune. Herd mentality is real, it takes *a lot* to swim against the current around here. You should try.

- Extending from that point, try and zoom out and also spend time with non-crypto people. 1 SOL or 0.08 ETH can seem like not significant amounts of money (unit bias is real), but add up how much that is per day or year and think what you could do with that money IRL. Also, most people are thrilled to earn a 10% return on their investments in a YEAR, and rightfully so. Thatâ€™s a great return, crypto just warps everything.

- Compound interest is mind boggling powerful. You donâ€™t need to find a 100x, youâ€™re usually way better off stringing together a bunch of 2x plays or even compounding at 10-50% a year (do the math, do you have any idea how insane compound interest is at high %s over a bunch of years?)

- Put another way: â€œMost people overestimate what they can achieve in a year and underestimate what they can achieve in ten years.â€

If you found this insightful, all I ask is that you drop a bookmark, share with a friend, and/or subscribe to my newsletter where I share a lot more ğŸ™

Cheers

I got an invite to a set of fundraising events for tech week. Some of them might be valuable, others not. And some will be valuable for some founders but not for others...

So should you decide what is valuable for your fundraising efforts?

it's important for everyone interested in raising capital to know that fundraising can be broken down into 2 main motions

1) showing people you're running a business that promises to do something they're interested in (different for different types of investors)

2) establishing trust / influence so they believe #1

Before you do anything in the name of fundraising, make sure you understand which category it falls into.  

Side note: #1 is all about making your business as good as it possibly can be without dollars coming in
